feat.value: world, as we walk in defilement and drunkenness and reveling and drinking and defiled idol worship. (1 Pet 4:3)
As we walk in wickedness and envy, becoming hated as we hate each other.
As we become disobedient and stray. (Titus 3:3)
As we walk in the vanity of our heart and become dark in our thoughts.
As we become alienated from the life of God because of the ignorance that is inside us because of our obstinacy.
As we have given over to defilement and doing every impure thing.
But now it is not in this way that we were taught. (Eph 4:17-20)
But rather what was taught to us is to do something for our salvation in fear and trembling.
For God is the one who enacts the will and the fulfillment of the will. (Phil 2:12-13)
And indeed the children of Israel, Moses saw them at that time in the way that they hastened to forget the commandments of God.
He commanded them to make fringes at the wings of their garments so that they might see them and think of the commandments of God and not forget them. (cf. Num 15:38-39)
Now let us too place the fear of God in our heart instead of the fringes, so that we do not forget the commandments that our fathers entrusted to us.
Therefore brothers let us turn around and repent while the opportunity is not yet lost for us, and while the light is still with us, which is the teachings of our fathers.
In the way that the Lord said: 'Walk as long as you have the light so that the darkness does not overtake you.' (Jn 12:35)
And: 'As we are in the day, let us walk while we are in propriety.' (Rom 13:13)
And: 'Those that sleep, it's at night that they sleep.
And those that are drunk, it is at night that they are drunk.
But we are of the day, let us be sober as we don the armor of faith.' (1 Thess 5:7-8)
